channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 23rd October
item.description:
Very poor and dangerous visibilty to traffic coming up the hill whilst trying to pull out of Foxcote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes and general breakdown of A40, 23rd October
item.description:
Between Arle Court roundabout and the off ramp for the M5, heading towards Gloucester. The road surface on the inside lane has had a large number of potholes since it was narrowed to widen the opposite carriageway. However one large one has appeared since the heavy rain last week.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 23rd October
item.description:
Customer has replaced an old, disused advertising sign that was at location with their current for sale sign. Asking if he requires highways permission as one leg is partially on the verge - see attached image

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 23rd October
item.description:
Pothole is 6-7 deep and a foot long Pothole. Drivers are now going over the white line in the middle of the road to avoid the pothole. Customer can hear vehicles hit the pothole from inside their house. At first they thought the sound was fireworks, until they realised the noise happened every time someone hit the pothole. Now that the pothole has gotten bigger, the sound has changed to a heavy thudding noise.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface at the junction of Goldsmith Road and Amberley Road, breaking up again, 23rd October
item.description:
There are some seriously large delivery trucks come round this corner regularly and the road is caved in with deep potholes. Can somebody come and have a look at it please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Amberley Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Problem with drainage problem, 23rd October
item.description:
Reporting:problem_with_drainage The reports are that when wet the puddles make it almost impassable for young kids and for those using prams/buggies etc; and when puddles dry up, the path is just sludgy for ages - which causes issues for users too.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 23rd October
item.description:
Trees Overhanging/overgrown limb The trees, brambles are now overgrown onto the road. when cars are parking against this wall (mostly those using the Victoria PH) they are now parking more into the road making it difficult for residents of Prince Albert Court to be able to manoeuvre out of our designated parking spaces
Report on FixMyStreet
